publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1086# Rhona Brankin: Proposed Midlothian Primary School Closures-That the Parliament notes the grave concerns of parents about the proposed closure of rural primary schools in Midlothian; acknowledges concerns about the short consultation process; recognises that, while the matter of school closure is primarily a subject for local authorities, they must act within the legislative framework of the Education (Scotland) Act 1980, the Education (Scotland) Act 1981 and the Standards in Scotland's Schools etc. Act 2000, and further notes that local authorities should be informed by the Scottish Executive's policies on the importance of rural services to sustainable rural communities and the need to promote rural businesses. Supported by: Bill Butler*
S2M-1086# Proposed Midlothian Primary School Closures (lodged on 23 March 2004) Jackie Baillie*, Mr John Home Robertson*, Maureen Macmillan*, Mike Pringle*, Scott Barrie*
S2M-1086# Proposed Midlothian Primary School Closures (lodged on 23 March 2004) Dr Elaine Murray*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*
